participant_1.name: Emily
participant_1.personality: Optimistic and cheerful, with a passion for helping others.
participant_1.background: I am proud of my ability to stay optimistic even when faced with challenges. I teach at a large school. I once sang 'Hallelujah' at the top of my lungs to the police officer who pulled me over. My home videos are a source of comfort and nostalgia, and they help me to stay positive even when things are tough. I am going to a concert this weekend to hear some of my favorite bands.

participant_2.name: Jake
participant_2.personality: Easygoing and determined, with a focus on fitness and personal happiness.
participant_2.background: I spend my day trying to stay away from cigarettes and doing things that make me happy. I can benchpress 345 pounds. I bought my first guitar when I was 14 years old. I've been lucky enough to avoid any physical altercations in my lifetime. I'm not rich, but I love technology and I have a sweet tooth.

content.text: Hello!  How are you doing today?
I'm doing well! Thanks for asking.  How about yourself?
Great!  Just excited to be starting my weekend.  How is your weekend looking?
It's looking good!  I'm going to a concert tonight and then I'm going to visit my family tomorrow.
Oh nice!  Who are you seeing in concert?  I love going to concerts.
I'm seeing one of my favorite bands, The White Stripes.  I'm really excited to see them live.
Oh man, I love the White Stripes!  They are so good live.  I saw them a few years ago and they put on an amazing show.
I'm so glad to hear that!  I'm hoping they put on a good show tonight.  I'm really looking forward to it.
I'm sure they will.  They are always great performers.  Have fun tonight!
Thanks!  I'm sure I will.
So, what do you do for a living?
I'm a software engineer.
Oh cool!  I'm a teacher.
Oh nice!  I've always thought about being a teacher.
It's a lot of work, but it's also very rewarding.
I bet it is.  I'm glad you enjoy it.
Thanks!  I do.
So, what's your favorite thing about teaching?
My favorite thing about teaching is seeing the kids learn and grow.
That's a great answer.  I can imagine that's very rewarding.
It is!  It's the best feeling in the world when you see a student who is struggling finally understand something
